attributes.action: Parents must be allowed access to their children unless a court rules otherwise.
attributes.background:
This petition is asking for it to be made illegal for one parent to deny the other access, without them being ruled as unfit by a court. 
 
 This petition is designed to protect children from the emotional damage that occurs when parents use them as a weapon against each other.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities can't make one parent allow the other access. The time it takes for one parent to regain access via the courts can leave lasting damage between a parent and child, who have then lost valuable time during crucial developmental stages, which can never be reclaimed. Unless there is good reason, such as the police suspecting physical abuse, then contact should not be denied, and the local authorities should have the power to ensure access is arranged by law, even if it's supervised

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell petrol/diesel engine cars in the UK from 2025
attributes.background:
This is already law in Holland and UK needs to follow ASAP
So only Electric Cars would be available for sale from that date.

attributes.action: Require Coroners, in suicide cases, to explore if best practice was followed.
attributes.background: Worldwide studies show that the involvement of family, friends & carers helps to reduce suicide. The document, http://bit.ly/1VUKDI5, agreed by all the professional bodies, advocates that unless there are good reasons not to do so, consent should always be sought to involve family, friends & carers.
attributes.additional_details: Rebecca Kelsall, see http://dailym.ai/1UWGJNx, died because GPs failed to follow RCGP guidelines CR152 and the NICE guidelines CG90 and CG91. This showed that the health service can be slow in keeping abreast with latest guidelines. As coroners have a duty to investigate whether death was avoidable, they are best placed to monitor whether best practice guidelines are followed.  As such, coroners should persistently ask clinicians and others for reports about processes and procedures followed.

attributes.action: Demand MPs to hold an anonymous poll on the EU Referendum (Stay/Leave)
attributes.background: MPs need to have their say on the EU Referendum led by their conscience to do the best for Britain. First, it is better to hold an anonymous poll so that MPs are not influenced by career ambitions of being re-elected (support their electoral area outcome even if they are fundamentally against it).
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum had an advisory role. The outcome was compromised by misleading information from the Leave campaign, topics included: NHS, immigration, free movement and the cost of the UKâ€™s EU membership. Millions of people didn't know what they voted for. 
This anonymous poll is designed to help MPs understand where they stand and proceed accordingly as the period of uncertainty is unquestionably bad for the economy.
MPs are required to vote in Britain's best interest by law.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for doctors to send males letters about a PSA BLOOD TEST
attributes.background: I want action as i find women get reminders to have regular smear tests done but males who are reaching the age of 50 have to ask to have a psa test done to check for prostate cancer and not alot of men know about this test

attributes.action: Reinstate compensation to sufferers of pleural plaque
attributes.background: I have been fighting for justice since 2007 with a number of trips to Parliament to speak to MPs asking for there support when the law lords sided with insurance companies to stop paying compensation to sufferers negligently exposed to asbestos
attributes.additional_details: Sir I am president of Swansea boilermakers gmb union and have had two early day motions put by my local MPs to no avail for justice  for all .I represented ship wrights boilermakers & blacksmiths who worked during the war on the mulberry harbour and flaying chains on tanks to destroy mines on the Normandy beaches who suffered  through being negligently exposed    to asbestos .lets not fore-get  them and give justice to all B T Legg.

attributes.action: BRCA - Provide a consistent approach to advice, care and support across the UK
attributes.background: There is an inconsistent approach to advice, care and support given to BRCA women and men across the UK. Women and men are being diagnosed with cancer every day when it could have been prevented. Let's make this change.
attributes.additional_details:
A questionnaire is currently underway to collate the inconsistencies from the health care. But some examples so far are;
1. Surveillance options for breast and Ovarian Cancer varies (available in some areas)
2. Assigned geneticists 
3. Inconsistent advice for BSO  
4. Availability of PGD / IVF 
5. Waiting times to see the breast surgeons
6. Availability of testing 

These are some. I am BRCA1 positive, Ambassador for BRCA Umbrella and Voice for OCA. I see it every day and it needs changing.

attributes.action: Make Continuous Glucose Monitors available on the NHS for Type 1 Diabetics
attributes.background:
CGMs are a considered less invasive than Blood Glucose Meters. They also help users to maintain target blood glucose levels & limit the risk of hypos.

Access to this technology is limited on the NHS. However, they can help to avoid night-time severe hypos, & severe hypos cost the NHS Â£13m a year.
attributes.additional_details:
CGMs work 24 hours a day and can include alarms to indicate when glucose levels are too high. Research suggests they can help to reduceÂ haemoglobin A1cÂ without increasing the risk of a hypo. 

The initial cost of the hardware for a continuous glucose monitor can vary from around Â£1,000 to Â£2,500. In addition to this, running costs are estimated at Â£40-Â£60 per 5-7 days. Access to this important technology should not be based upon whether or not the patient is able to afford it.

attributes.action: Child Benefit to be taxed based on household income and not one parents salary
attributes.background: Currently if a single person earns over Â£50k a year they have to pay a tax charge on child benefit, earn over Â£60k and you have to pay more tax than child benefit so there is no point in claiming. However a couple can have a joint income of Â£98k (Â£49k each) and receive the full Child Benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
I feel very strongly about this and the difference in receiving or not receiving Child Benefit may influence financial decisions for many families.

Child Benefit is Â£20.70 per week for one child and Â£13.79 for an additional child. For some families this makes a huge difference. 

Why should families with a household income of less than Â£98k receive their full entitlement to Child Benefit and yet a family with one working parent who earns over Â£48k not?

attributes.action: Regulate Private Hire Fares
attributes.background: To regulate Private hire fares to minimum wage. To make sure that all operators follow them correctly.

attributes.action: Prevent any Council setting up charges for Park Run or any similar event.
attributes.background: Little Stoke Parish Council have begun to charge runners Â£1 to participate in its local Park Run. An event which helps and encourages people to get out and run or walk 5km once a week.
attributes.additional_details: Park Run is a free global organised run and should be kept that way.

attributes.action: Get Pam Carlson's Deportation OVERTURNED!
attributes.background: Pam has lived in the UK for 7 YEARS, she came over on a Domestic Visa, but split from her long term partner, therefore being deported. She works, lives and contributes to this country as well as being an avid fund raiser for animal charities. She does nothing but GIVE, never taken a penny from theUK
attributes.additional_details: What more information do you need, other than she works, lives, and has a LIFE here in the UK. She fund raises, she helps others, and she is one of the nicest people anyone has ever known.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring Councils to publish  Development Control Committees votes.
attributes.background: These committees take decisions affecting our lives. Their decisions can be worth Â£millions to developers. The current system where votes are counted on a show of hands is unsatisfactory. These committees are open to corruption. Parliament must pass a law requiring Councillor's votes be published.
attributes.additional_details: This is a zero cost proposal; no public money needs to be spent. If this proposal is adopted these committees will be more democratic and more worthy of trust from the people that they represent. Cynicism is rife regarding local government Councillors. This proposal will go some way to reducing this. Councillors should be accountable to the people who vote for them. How can they be held to account if we can't know how they vote?

attributes.action: Make the documents relating to David Kelly's death public
attributes.background:
David Kelly's death, a UN weapons inspector, shortly followed the WMD inspections in 2003. In 2010, the government deemed the circumstances around his death 'should be kept secret' for 70 years.
Following the Chilcot report today, I feel these documents should be released in the public interest.

attributes.action: Protect the financially vulnerable with a system which blocks lending.
attributes.background: Currently, in the UK, we do not have a system that protects people that are financially vulnerable and who do not have capacity to make such important financial decisions. Meaning vulnerable adults can be signed up to credit agreements accumulating debt without the carers knowledge.
attributes.additional_details:
We appreciate it would be impossible to vet every person who applies for lending, yet we would like the credit reference agencies to apply markers to credit files to prevent lending to vulnerable people being agreed. 

These could be applied by carers or medical professionals either on a temporary or permanent basis. We believe this would not only provide relief for the carer but also protection for all vulnerable adults no matter who the lender may be.

attributes.action: KS2 Reading SATs was unfair on pupils & shouldnâ€™t be counted in performance data
attributes.background: Unlike other Key Stage 2 subjects, the Reading paper differed significantly from the sample test. We fully support a drive to increase standards, but the level of vocabulary was above beyond most 11 year olds. This poor communication of expectations by the DfE should not punish pupils or schools.
attributes.additional_details: The number of inferential questions was far higher, with fewer literal, than the sample. Both were inaccessible to lower attainers, who couldnâ€™t show skills learned. In past/sample tests pupils found key words in a question to retrieve information/infer answers. This test required pupils find synonyms of key words. Teachers would have taught this had it been indicated in sample materials/Programme of Study. Itâ€™s unfair to test children on skills for which there was no indication to teachers.

attributes.action: Set up a Royal Commission to look at the NHS provision of care.
attributes.background: It is clear the politicians and clinicians are unable to decide what the tax pound should be spent on in the NHS.  The impasse can only be broken by a Royal Commission looking at the NHS. Only a Royal Commission can decide what the NHS,  in EU parlance, 'should', 'shall' and 'should not' provide.

attributes.action: Ban the making and receiving of all phone calls whilst driving.
attributes.background: Cars kill. Research clearly shows a person is distracted from driving and their reaction times are slowed if on the phone, even if they are using it hands-free. No phone call is worth a distraction that could cause death. Help save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence shows making and receiving calls distracts drivers and slows their reaction times. A caller can always leave a message and call or be called back. If it is important they will be in touch.
 
Radio 5 live programme ( starts 8.30 mins) 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07dj0zj

attributes.action: Please make it LAW to Scan all animals on a regular basis at the vets
attributes.background:
Currently in the UK they're are no laws with dogs/cats/animals getting scanned on a regular basis when they visit the vets. 
There is very sadly a big problem in the UK with dogs/cats getting stolen or going missing. Please Sign & Share to help this happen. 
Shocking that it is not law already.
attributes.additional_details:
All vets need to scan on new appointments, and scan on a regular basis. The Microchip can also disappear or move.
Some people find them and do not hand them in to the right authorities(dog warden etc) like it is law to do. 
My personal experience in the past each time my dogs have been scanned I have had to request it. This should not be the case.
Luckily I did that, as if my dog did go missing I would of never of got him back as his chip vanished. Dogs have a chip for a REASON
Dogs' are Family

attributes.action: Citizenship Granted to Ex-Servicemen & Women after serving in the British Forces
attributes.background: Stop sending Ex-Service Man & Women after serving in the British Army,Navy & Royal Air Force.Especially Foreign & Commonwealth Soldiers.After giving there life to Queen n the United Kingdom,domestic & Abroad,Iraq,Afghanistan & Bosnia and other places

attributes.action: Pressure public establishments to provide baby changing facilities for men.
attributes.background:
There are still many public facilities where child changing facilities are either housed in the ladies toilets or simply not available to men at all. 
We urge the government to pressure businesses of all sizes to ensure men have equal opportunity to access changing facilities for their children.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on key Brexit deals BEFORE giving Article 50 notice
attributes.background: There is no democracy without informed consent. Voters did not know before 23 June the terms on which we would leave the EU, the global trade deals which would be done or our immigration policy following Brexit. These must be agreed and voted on BEFORE we give irrevocable Art 50 notice to leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 50 is a one way street.  Once it gives one, that state must leave the EU after 2 years (or more if the remaining 27 agree).  We do not need to give notice until we KNOW that the terms we would have (both with the EU and the rest of the world) would be better outside than inside the EU.

We should promptly negotiate with the EU and others and put these deals to the electorate.  Only if the electorate votes in favour should we leave.  A statute should stop notice being given otherwise.

attributes.action: Call a general election immediately after Conservative party leadership decided
attributes.background: Labour & Conservatives contested the 2015 General Election with policies based on continuing EU membership.David Cameron has now resigned.The political landscape is now changed.Parties must devise new manifestos based on EU exit & transition & put to the electorate to decide who leads us through it.

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid & use the money to increase the defence budget and armed forces
attributes.background:
We believe the the Government should reduce the Foreign Aid budget back to Â£8.4bn, the level it was at in 2010.
The Foreign Aid budget is set to rise to almost Â£16bn by 2020.
We believe this additional funding should be moved to beef up our defence capabilities and our marvellous armed forces.
attributes.additional_details:
The Foreign Aid budget is too high and is subject to abuse.
We believe that the budget should be reduced to Â£8.4bn & the commitment of a minimum of 2% GDP on defence spending is increased.
Our armed forces are amongst the best in the world.
We should reflect this by boosting our defence budget & spending on our armed forces.
In an ever more dangerous world, we should spend more on beefing up our defence budget.
We believe that the best way to achieve this is to cut Foreign Aid & boost Defence

attributes.action: Veterans injury compensation to be protected and disregarded for benefits!!
attributes.background:
If a veteran recieves compensation as a result of an injury caused whilst serving our country - i believe it should be protected and disregarded for benefit entitlement.
Recieving compensation shouldn't effect a veteran claiming benefits inc ESA, JSA and housing when they return to civilian life.
attributes.additional_details:
At present compensation is classed as savings. If a veteran recieves over Â£6,000, their entitlement to benefit may be affected  (reduced). If a veteran recieves more than Â£16,000 then they may not be entitled to the benefit at all. 

Veterans should be able to choose how they use their compensaton, and not be turned away for benefits and expected to live off it!

Help protect our veterans and their compensaton by signing my petition in support, thankyou :)

attributes.action: Ban 'Fracking' (Hydraulic fracturing for shale gas) in the UK.
attributes.background: We the undersigned UK residents support a law that condems Hydraulic Fracturing (fracking) of shale gas deposits from UK land and the retrieval or sale of any gas that could be produced from such places. We demand investment in gas produced from anerobic deigestion of organic waste.
attributes.additional_details: Fracking involves drilling past the depth of the water table and injecting water, toxic and radioactive chemicals at high pressure into the rockbed. It is contaminates the water table which is part of the hydrologic cycle. It is environmentally unsustainable. 200 countries  have agreed to end the fossil fuel era. We are therefore asking this and future governments to support this agreement and ban hydraulic fractuing in the UK, investing in green gas instead.

attributes.action: Monitoring in pregnancy for every woman who has received cervical treatments
attributes.background:
Myself & my fiancÃ© lost our beautiful baby boy, Oscar, after he was born prematurely at 24 weeks. 
My waters broke due to an incompetent cervix that was never checked or monitored despite having part of my cervix removed after a Lletz procedure.
attributes.additional_details:
The amount of cells that were removed from my cervix were classified as low risk and therefore no further monitoring or checks were made during pregnancy. Had I been monitored my incompetent cervix would have been diagnosed and our perfect son may be here today. 
I am petitioning for every pregnant woman who has undergone any type of treatment compromising their cervix to be monitored during their pregnancy to prevent baby losses like ours occurring in the future.

attributes.action: Change UK Immigration Policy so that families like the Brains may reside here.
attributes.background: The Brain Family in Dingwall moved over from Australia under a visa programme that was subsequently revoked without any exceptions being made for them.  After much publicity and support from their MP and the First Minister of Scotland, their stay has been extended but are prohibited from employment.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Government policy on immigration should be changed to take due account of the following:

-     Where people have resettled here at considerable personal expense under a previous immigration programme.

-      Whether people come from Commonwealth countries where the Queen is Head of State.

-      The opinions and recommendations of their local elected representatives and of the Leader of the democratically-elected devolved Government should carry an appropriate level of weighting by UK Gov.

attributes.action: Reduce the retirement age for workers in physical jobs.
attributes.background: In physical jobs people's bodies don't last to the new and ever increasing retirement age. Builders, postmen, farm workers are just a few examples. In my Job (postal industry) workers have worn out joints and limbs after a relitvly short time in the industry. Some will retire almost crippled.

attributes.action: Increase quality control on developers of new-build properties
attributes.background: House builders  are throwing up houses at a rate of knots in order to maximise return and as a result overlooking basic quality control measures. Contracts are being issued that allow them to rectify all defects post completion and thus letting them remain until legal completion
attributes.additional_details:
REFERENCES:

http://www.new-home-blog.co.uk/the-day-taylor-wimpey-ruined-my-life/

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2950799/Cracks-walls-no-loft-insulation-3-000-kitchen-worktop-doesn-t-fit-Homeowner-finds-140-problems-brand-new-580-000-house-sets-Twitter-account-list-them.html

attributes.action: Make electronic dog collars illegal to own and use in the UK.
attributes.background: Electronic dog collars are an outdated form of torture to help control dog barking through pain and fear. They have no place in society where other affordable options are widely available. A substantial fine and prison sentence should be the punishment for this form of animal cruelty.

attributes.action: Declare the actions of Daesh against minorities as genocide
attributes.background: Daesh is committing genocide against those who do not subscribe to their mis-interpretation of Islam. Notably against the minority: Christians, Yezidi, Turkmen, Shabak, Kurds & Shia. The UK must follow the example of the European Parliament and formally acknowledge the genocide, so it can be stopped

attributes.action: Keep the ban on neonics to protect the bees!
attributes.background: Despite the fact that bee-endangering pesticides are banned in the EU, the UK government just gave the go-ahead to farmers to sow these toxic-coated seeds anyway. Any day now, Bayer and Syngenta's toxic bee-harming seeds could be sown.
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of listening to us, the Government listened to the intensive farming industry - ignoring the growing evidence of how dangerous these chemicals are to bees and other pollinators.

Hundreds of thousands of people have already signed other petitions to the UK Government to stop harming our bees, and they're feeling the sting. A massive public outcry could force the government to back down and protect bees.

attributes.action: Educate all health professionals and teachers on Autism!!
attributes.background: Autism is a condition that not many people are aware of unless they have experience of it, as a result people with this condition are becoming more socially excluded in everyday life. People with the condition face constant battles and are misunderstood and judged due to the lack of education.

attributes.action: Stop Sodexo from closing Katie's Kitchen
attributes.background: Katie's kitchen is a food van that his been running for over 20 years and now is being shut down by the greed of Sodexo. Katie's kitchen has given joy to surviving soldiers for many many years by coming out on exercise and saving the troops from the rotting stomach of ration packs
attributes.additional_details: Sodexo food is over priced and under quality. They will double the price of Katie's kitchen and they don't want any competition

attributes.action: No longer allow letting agents to discriminate against 'dss'
attributes.background: I am disabled due to a stroke and receive housing Benefits to top up the wage I earn.  Letting agents are allowed to discriminate against this, regardless of circumstance. It harks back to the time when people were allowed to discriminate against skin colour and nationality.
attributes.additional_details: Where your funds come from should make no difference, housing benefit can be more reliable than wages in that you can't be fired! I have rented receiving benefits as a single person, a single mother, part of a couple and now as a disabled parent. I have always been discriminated against. Let's make this change and not victimise the most vulnerable of our society. Let's not be those people.

attributes.action: Tougher legislation for manufacturers & retailers to reduce excessive packaging
attributes.background: The excessive unnecessary amount of packaging on products is disgusting. You can see it on  everything from food to vacuum cleaners. It is so wasteful and damaging to the environment, as well costly to local councils struggling to deal with the level of waste removal and re-cycling.

attributes.action: Let 92 yr old Myrtle Cothill remain in the UK with her daughter for her care
attributes.background: H.O.decision to deport 92-year-old who wants to spend her last days with her only child in Britain,she is independent from the state with Â£300 a month pension.
attributes.additional_details: She has an enlarged heart, suffers poor hearing and has lost the sight in one eye because of macular degeneration, but neither her condition nor her advanced age is enough to secure her the comfort of life with her daughter.She has been in Dorset since February 2014 and made an application to the Home Office for leave to remain the country as an adult dependent on human rights grounds.â€œMyrtle is dependent on both the emotional and physical care of her daughter

attributes.action: Make the BBC declare an interest when broadcasting on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: When directors of companies or MP's are involved in decision making where they have any financial or commercial interest, they are duty bound to declare that interest. The BBC coverage of the EU referendum  can be seen as biased as they receive a grant from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: BBC has received Â£2m in EU funding in run up to referendum, fuelling accusations of bias. (source Daily Telegraph)

attributes.action: End gvt. contracts to companies which avoid UK tax, or advise on tax avoidance
attributes.background: Many large corporations are benefitting from huge government contracts, grants & subsidies while avoiding corporation tax in the UK. The law should prevent the award of government contracts or funds to companies that do not pay tax on ALL their UK income, or to companies that advise on tax avoidance
attributes.additional_details: Many companies - including those running publicly-funded services - do not pay tax on the money they make in the UK, though their businesses & employees depend on the services & infrastructure paid for by UK taxpayers. Meanwhile large accountancy & management consultancy firms benefit from lucrative government contracts while also advising clients on how to avoid paying tax. Public money - grants subsidies & contracts - should not be awarded to tax-avoiding companies or those advising them.

attributes.action: Stop Michael Fallon from spending Â£642m on Trident before a vote in Parliament.
attributes.background: Defence Secretary, Michael Fallon, is due to announce spending Â£642 million of public money on renewing Trident despite the fact that the issue of whether to replace the UK's nuclear weapons will not be voted on in Parliament until later this year.
attributes.additional_details:
Spending this money on Trident will make it more difficult for the UK to pull out of its nuclear weapon programme as a significant amount of money will already have been invested in its renewal.

This is a unilateral and undemocratic decision by the Defence Secretary that will contribute to the vote in Parliament later this year swinging in favour of renewing the weapons, compromising the impartiality of such a vote. No spending on the programme should be allowed until the vote has taken place.

attributes.action: Improve air quality & tackle climate change by promoting shale gas & renewables
attributes.background: Around 30% of UK electricity is still generated by burning coal, releasing large quantities of climate changing CO2 emissions and air pollutants. Government can change this by promoting a shale gas and renewables boom, avoiding 'technology tribalism' and helping secure our clean energy future.
attributes.additional_details:
Coal-fired power generation in the United States has fallen to its lowest level since 1949 as a result of a shale gas and renewables boom. It's helped to reduce climate changing CO2 emissions by a massive 32%

The UK Government can create the conditions for us to repeat this success by designating wind, solar, shale gas, biogas and waste-to-energy as Nationally Significant Infrastructure Projects, helping to cut planning red-tape, improve investor certainty and get more capacity built.

attributes.action: Launch an Independent Inquiry into Hunt's Junior Doctor contract & 7day NHS plan
attributes.background: The Health Secretary has misrepresented data to claim a non-existent weekend mortality effect. The Public Accounts committee says his 7-day NHS plan is unfunded. His proposed contract has alienated a generation of doctors. We demand an Independent Inquiry into Hunt's actions and their consequences.
attributes.additional_details:
Public Accounts Committee report: http://www.parliament.uk/business/committees/committees-a-z/commons-select/public-accounts-committee/news-parliament-2015/nhs-staff-numbers-report-published-15-16/

Studies demonstrate Hunt's purported weekend effect - the basis for imposing his Junior Doctor contract - does not exist: http://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/06/fewer-die-in-hospital-weekends-study-jeremy-hunt-doctors-contract

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty for those who murder children.
attributes.background: All to often children's live's are being taken from the same people who are meant to raise them. This petition is calling for the execution of these murderers, if not becoming a deterrent at least it will serve as justice for the children who never got a chance.

attributes.action: Official EU Referendum RESULT of LEAVE announced 24TH JUNE 2016 must be CARRIED.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to ENFORCE THE WILL OF THE PEOPLE as decided in the free and democratic EU REFERENDUM VOTE ON 23RD JUNE 2016 and as stated by Prime Minister David Cameron that the Brexit vote was the "will of the British people" and an "instruction which must be delivered"
attributes.additional_details:
Prime Minister demonstrated his FULL ACCEPTANCE of the result of the EU Referendum on 23rd June 2016, stating that the will of the British people on THAT vote was an instruction that MUST be delivered. This followed his resignation to the Queen, and later to his Government and The Country. 

This EU Referendum gained more votes in total than any General Election in UK history, the LEAVE RESULT also gained more votes than any political party taking office post a General Election. RESULT TO STAND.

attributes.action: Reform the IR35 Tax Regulations introduced in 2000.
attributes.background: The IR35 Regulations, introduced in 2000 to address the differences in liabilities due to HMRC between an employee and a self-employed freelance contractor providing services under a limited company, is a highly subjective, unclear and disproportionate piece of legislation that should be amended.
attributes.additional_details:
Specific reforms sought are:

Absolute clarity for a contractor of his/her IR35 status prior to a contract being signed so that appropriate rates can be negotiated.

Within IR35 status calculations:

Have sufficient allowances for expenses, particularly for travelling freelance contractors (rather than just 5% currently).

Exempt ENICs from the IR35 calculations, as regular employees do not pay ENICs.

Build sufficient allowances into the calculations to recognise a lack of employee benefits.

attributes.action: Change the prejudiced welfare system - Keep families together!
attributes.background: The welfare system does not grant enough rights to families to care for grandchildren. It is too prejudiced.  They are far too eager to take babies away for adoption. We need reform in the current system please.
attributes.additional_details: I can provide references which a personal to me but also which I am absolutely positive that other families out there will be in the same position to provide.

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to send the brightest and best international students home
attributes.background: New Immigration Rules (HC877) require students to return home if they secure a work placement year or perform better than expected and are upgraded (e.g. BEng to MEng). This is penalising the brightest and best, it is unfair and damages the UK's reputation. This decision should be reversed.
attributes.additional_details:
On 08/04/2016, the UK Council for International Student Affairs received the following:
"A student who needs more time to complete a course can only apply for further leave to do this if they meet one of the exemptions set out in 120A(a).  A student who undertakes a work placement would be changing their course and would therefore need to apply from overseas if they wanted to extend their leave to complete their (new) course."
The explanatory memorandum to HC877 does not detail this consequence.

attributes.action: Free sun cream for all school children
attributes.background: I have been recently been diagnosed with skin cancer, being only 28 this has come as a bit of a shock. being a red head, fair skinned , and freckly I always kept an eye on skin changes but you still think it wont happen to you. This then flagged up and made me take notice the price of sun cream.
attributes.additional_details:
Every child should have access to sun cream, especially march-October, teachers, anybody in a position of care to a child should be allowed to apply sun cream where they see fit.
Sun damage ages the skin but also raises the risk of skin cancer, one of the most preventable cancer. I believe all school children should receive a 'sunstart' pack containing a sun hat, sun cream, and information sheet, a bottle of water , and an activity pack. FREE SUN CREAM FOR ALL SCHOOL CHILDREN.

attributes.action: Don't leave the EU without guarantees of Vote Leave's promises
attributes.background:
The Vote Leave campaign said the UK could have: 1. Â£350 million a week back from the EU, for spending on the NHS, 2. Control of migration policy, and 3. Continued access to the single market.
We call on HM Government not to leave the EU without cast-iron guarantees to meet these three key pledges.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that leaders must be accountable, and that promises to voters matter. If and when HM Government invokes Article 50, the UK will have to leave the EU within two years, even if it cannot get a good deal. Any EU country could prevent the UK joining again. We call on HM Government not to leave the EU, and not to invoke article 50, without guarantees that these Vote Leave pledges will be met.
